snippet: Paul Ryan, who voted for the Glass-Steagall repeal in 1999, today says banks should not be too big to fail. And he differs with Wall Street on some other points as well.
abstract: Paul Ryan, who voted for the Glass-Steagall repeal in 1999, today says banks should not be too big to fail. And he differs with Wall Street on some other points as well.

headline.main: Everything Wall St. Should Know About Ryan
headline.print_headline: Everything Wall St. Should Know About Ryan

snippet: The Internet giant is buying the travel guide maker from John Wiley & Sons to expand its local and travel search results.
abstract: The Internet giant is buying the travel guide maker from John Wiley & Sons to expand its local and travel search results.

headline.main: Google Plans to Buy Frommer's Travel Guides
headline.print_headline: Google Says It Will Buy Frommer’s For Content

snippet: Asia’s economic endurance has helped offset weakness in the United States and Europe, but recent gains have been smaller than expected.
abstract: Stocks fall as evidence piles up that the global economic slowdown is hurting Asia.

headline.main: Slower Growth in Asia Drags Down Markets
headline.print_headline: Slower Growth in Asia Drags Down Markets

snippet: Motorola Mobility, the ailing cellphone maker that Google bought in May, told employees Sunday that it would lay off 20 percent of its work force and close a third of its 94 offices worldwide, Claire Cain Miller reports in Monday's New York Times.
abstract: Motorola Mobility, the ailing cellphone maker that Google bought in May, told employees Sunday that it would lay off 20 percent of its work force and close a third of its 94 offices worldwide, Claire Cain Miller reports in Monday's New York Times.

headline.main: Daily Report: Google Unveils Plans for Motorola

snippet: The magazine has received a Pew Charitable Trusts grant for an ambitious study of the safety of meat, poultry and other food items that will begin in the fall.
abstract: The magazine has received a Pew Charitable Trusts grant for an ambitious study of the safety of meat, poultry and other food items that will begin in the fall.

headline.main: Consumer Reports Receives $2 Million Grant for Food Safety Study

snippet: After his father died, Paul D. Ryan formed a self-reliance that would shape his worldview and one day capture the imagination of Mitt Romney.

byline.original: By JENNIFER STEINHAUER, JIM RUTENBERG, MIKE McINTIRE and SHERYL GAY STOLBERG

snippet: The cuts are the first step in Google’s plan to reinvent the company that it bought in May, and to shore up its Android mobile business and expand beyond search and software.
abstract: Motorola Mobility, ailing cellphone maker that Google bought in May, will lay off 20 percent of its work force, or 4,000 people, and close a third of its 94 offices worldwide; cuts are the first step in Google's plan to reinvent Motorola, and to shore up its Android mobile business and expand beyond search and software into the manufacture of hardware.

headline.main: Motorola Set for Big Cuts as Google Reinvents It
headline.print_headline: Motorola Set For Big Cuts As Google Reinvents It

snippet: A billboard in Manhattan leads off a campaign for Stride Mintacular gum, mimicking Apple’s dominant typeface: “Chewing redefined. Again.”
abstract: Andrew Adam Newman Advertising column highlights campaign for Kraft's Stride Mintacular gum.

headline.main: Stride’s New Flavor of Chewing Gum: Red Herring
headline.print_headline: Stride’s New Flavor of Chewing Gum: Red Herring

snippet: Verizon Wireless and AT&T are cutting the subsidies they pay customers when they buy cellphones, but that did not prevent the Deutsch Telekom unit from losing more customers.

byline.original: By CORNELIUS RAHN and KATHLEEN CHAYKOWSKI | BLOOMBERG NEWS

snippet: 8:56 p.m. | Updated  3:37 p.m. | Updated with reported purchase price.SAN FRANCISCO -  Google  made another foray into producing original content Monday when it announced its plans to buy the Frommer's brand of travel guides from  John Wiley & Son...
abstract: Google is buying the Frommer's brand of travel guides from John Wiley & Sons for $23 million to expand its local and travel search results. Photo (M)1

headline.main: Google Says It Will Buy Frommer's For Content
